Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Madrid on a budget”
Reviews.Author: dav-han
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apartamentos Juan Bravo for a couple of nights this August, it's in a good location very close to the Diego de Leon metro stop not far from the centre of Madrid. The apartment was spacious with a small kitchen within the lounge area, a separate bedroom and modern bathroom. The air conditioning wasn't great and made the room smell of smoke one night, also we did hear a bit of noise from other rooms however overall we had a good couple of night's sleep here! The pool was a great addition, especially after a long day of walking around Madrid. The apartments are next door to a good supermarket that sold everything we needed to make our own meals so overall our stay was really good value for money and cheaper than many of Madrid's numerous hotels. It's not particularly luxurious but perfect for a few nights in Madrid, with more space than you'd find in your average hotel and the added bonus of being able to self cater too!

Reviews.Title: “Self-catering on a budget”
Reviews.Author: LianneDM
Reviews.Content: It was great to stop off at these self-contained apartments halfway through our interrailing trip around Spain. We had the time and space to do some laundry, and saved a fortune on buying breakfast and packed lunch ingredients from the supermarket downstairs. Very easy to get to from one of the metro exits (look for the ones marked with 'Juan Bravo' - it's the one with the big glass doors and small shrubs in the porch area. It feels very safe because of the 24hr guard downstairs. The downsides are: the wifi was temperamental and it took a long time to set up, which was irritating as it's a paid-for extra. Also the walls aren't particularly sound proof, and we were woken up by other residents having parties, leaning out of windows smoking and talking, and even our neighbours flushing the loo.

Reviews.Title: “Great for independent, budget-minded travellers”
Reviews.Author: 8-l
Reviews.Content: Had everything we wanted for 45 euros per night: Quiet location in Salamanca not too far from the city center (45 to 60 minutes walking time); heated room with kitchenette; grocery store next door; Diego de Leon metro station 30 yards away at the intersection of Conde de Penalver; and easy to transfer to and from the airport on the metro. Did have a bit of difficulty finding the hotel when we first arrived, as there is no signage outside the building, just the numbers 58 and 60 on two pillars, with dark glass doors between them. Location is just to the right of Simply market grocery store, with a bright yellow storefront. One minor problem was not with the hotel, but with the metro station exit/entrance access, there are a few steps, so a with heavy suitcase we had a bit of a struggle.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an extended stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: I spend a month in Madrid each summer and this place is great for my purpose. The location can't be beat; Salamanca barrio has everything! Three metro lines stop at the door. Grocery store is in the building. Great cafe/bar just in front. The lobby attendants are always helpful, even if they don't smile much. Wifi is spotty, as in much of Madrid. The pool is great! I swim laps every day, but there's plenty of room for "laying out" and playing. The rooms on the pool side are quieter than those on the street side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not recommended due to poor beds”
Reviews.Author: Theodore D
Reviews.Content: The good: - great location - metro is a few steps away, in the middle of the city - very very clean - good space with a kitchenette, sitting area, dining area, bedroom - price - staff is ok but beware, they don't speak english The bad: - the beds are FAR too small. I am 6'3 and i had to sleep w/ my legs hanging over the end of the bed. also they are as hard as rocks and are tiny singles. I don't understand why they can't get the bed situation correct in Spain... US hotels do it so much better! - the shower is not consistent. Upon start up, it is scalding hot, with no ability to cool it down. Then suddenly it is chilly... then scalding hot again. If you are patient (3 minutes) it will sort itself out though. Another humorous thing is the size of the bathroom soap bars- so tiny you won't believe it - no alarm clock in the room - TV didnt work - wifi available for extra charge but didnt work well at all - you really have to be in or close to the lobby All the comments about location in the reviews are correct- it's in a great spot. However, for me the bedding situation was absolutely unacceptable... you dont want to compound jetlag sleep issues with poor bedding. All of the other issues are not that important.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic find!!!”
Reviews.Author: VisitorfromMaryland
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic find!!! This is a 1 minute walk to a metro with three lines. The studio apt was sooo clean and had the cutest kitchenette which made breakfasts a delight. THe grocery store is right next door. It is a three minute walk to the famous Chocloteria Valor for churros and chocolate. Gino on the fornt desk made our stay a delight by expalining about the thermostat is behind the curtains and calling us at 3:30 am to wake us up on the last dfay and called the taxi for us. You leave a card key in the door to keep the heat or a/c on during the day, since the a/c and heat are off at night. The washer/dryer at Euro 3 were great. There is a cyber cafe directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dublinia2000
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very reasonable prices, nice apartments. If you are looking for better, take out your credit card and pay the big bucks - otherwise this is a great option. I've stayed here on three separate visits to Madrid and will do so again if I'm back for a fourth.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, convenient, but the beds are short”
Reviews.Author: carolinetxu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an apartment rather than a studio, and I recommend it if you need quiet and a good night's sleep. The passages are all wide and carpeted so we didn't hear much from other occupants; the bedroom has blackout curtains; there is no noise from air conditioning; the doors are good quality; and the mattresses were very firm and seemed to be of very good quality. However, they are only 180 centimetres long, so you're out of luck if you're tall. The building is very close to Diego de León metro station and right next door to a proper supermarket with good food -- not a Kwik-E-Mart. In summer you can enjoy the famous café terraces in Juan Bravo street. There is also a dry-cleaners nearby, though I didn't check to see if they do laundry. Having read the reviews here, we brought our own sponge and washing-up liquid, and cooked for ourselves and two friends each night. The hole-in-the-wall kitchen is obviously not really meant for four-person meals, but we got by, and had just enough cutlery and plates. The concierge said with a rueful smile that the soap dispensers in the kitchens of the apartments had stopped working. But everything else in the apartment was well maintained and perfectly clean. Oh, and if you expect not to speak Spanish in Spain you may have problems. As far as I was aware, the Spanish people at the desk weren't multilingual.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: LanneP
Reviews.Content: These apartments are in a perfect central location of the Salamanca district,friendly 24 hour reception, clean twin rooms, we heard no noise as mentioned in other reviews.overall is way better than expected for 3* apartments. The pool photo isn't great so we were pleasantly surprised to find a large pool, spotlessly maintained with loads of terrace space and loungers open 11-9. There is a perfect cafe/tapas bar dead opposite the entrance where u can sit outside for coffee, breakfast, beer, lunch & dinner in sun or shade. Next door us a super Market- perfect! & round 1 corner 1 min walk is a pharmacy & tabaconist store. many more shops within easy walk. It is a safe and friendly area, perfect if u want to learn Spanish as not much English spoken but who wants to hear English on holiday?! We are a 30year old couple visiting for a long weekend from England and this couldn't have suited us better, would def come again :) If I had to leave a negative comment it would have been nice to have z drinks kiosk by the pool. The room was even cleaned and towels changed on day 2! Better than some 5*! Arrive expecting little and you will be really impressed:)

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a quiet neighborhood with easy access to metro and city center.”
Reviews.Author: SylviaAbroad
Reviews.Content: We were concerned when we read a previous review that the pool wasn't open. But we called and they confirmed it was. I have heard that they don't open pools here until July. So while my husband is studying at school during the day, I have been enjoying the pool, the good shopping in walking distance, and the easy access to the metro. No problems with noise, except a bit of traffic noise (especially the night they won the World Cup!). It is a very quiet, clean, and safe neighborhood. The room is sufficient for two of us with all the basic, clean amenities. Cleaning twice a week for month-long guests. I do wish the bed was bigger though. Some of the staff at reception aren't as friendly as others. But it's true that this is more of a residential apartment building than a hotel. And this is exactly what we were looking for since we're here for a month. We can cook for ourselves, or eat out at any of the nearby restaurants if we want. There are laundry facilities in the building, and the grocery store is literally 10 steps out the door. If you want to experience more of the feel for local life during your stay here, for a good price, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “no pool!”
Reviews.Author: kate1n
Reviews.Content: We booked this apartment for myself, partner and 18 year old daughter. The idea was that my partner and I could do the cultural bits during the day whilst she sunned herself by the pool. No such luck! Although it still advertises having a pool, it has obviously been out of use for a very long time! The apartments felt very residential, not for tourists. Although clean and reasonably equipped, there is no natural light coming into any of the rooms, which feels very depressing. The noise is a bit of a problem, but we felt the lack of air con was a bigger one. The reception staff were awful- rude and unhelpful. We asked if we our bags could be stored after we checked out. Anyone would have thought we had asked for the impossible - but after much huffing and puffing a room was unlocked to reveal a dedicated luggage room! I appreciate that it is close to a metro and next door to a supermarket (note- closed on Thursday), but that said, I would not recommend this place to any other tourist traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, thin walls, loud parties...no sleep before 2 a.m.!!”
Reviews.Author: natociv
Reviews.Content: Cheap stay but beware, you get what you pay for. Three good points: great location, low cost, next to supermarket. Three bad points: Noise, Noise, Noise. The walls are paper thin, you can hear EVERYTHING in the other rooms on the sides and above. The amount of parties in the place makes it seem more like of a Frat house. We had to move twice within the building because of the drunks and inconsiderate types that frequent the establishment. My advice, if you can afford a little more, think about staying at a proper hotel. Otherwise, bring some earplugs if you desire to sleep before 2 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “i'm a regular”
Reviews.Author: mnanc
Reviews.Content: Apartamentos Juan Bravo has been my "home away from home" for many years. I return every summer and stay for a month or a month and a half. It is ideal for anyone who plans to stay in Madrid for a week or longer because the price is assessed by the week or month. Staying a week is about the same price-wise as staying for 4 days. I also recommend for the self-service laundry, which is crucial for visits lasting longer than a week. As others have mentioned, there is a small grocery store right next door. There's a great breakfast place about 2 blocks away and a bookstore (Crisol) is 3 blocks distant. The bars in the area are exceptionally good and frequented by locals and not tourists. You can pay extra for internet connection but it's also possible to connect directly without paying anything. The staff is very nice and does its best to attend to visitors and their needs. However, keep in mind that this is not a hotel. The individual who mans the desk is not there to recommend restaurants and such, rather he is there for the safety of the guests to monitor the traffic in and out of the apartments. I would especially recommend to individuals who speak some Spanish, since this area is mostly residential and doesn't cater to tourists. I'd say that's one of the principal attractions to this locale, that it gives a sense of what real life is like in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better, But Lots of Room”
Reviews.Author: Zoomie1106
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in early May. Its central, lots of restaurants nearby, Metro station literally at the end of the block. The rooms are decent sized (not massive, but we were 3 adults and had plenty of room). Its not really a hotel, but more an apartment building in which the apartments are rented out by the day or week. We had a kitchenette with microwave, fridge/freezer, sink, dishes. Bathroom was clean and good sized, with a tub/shower. We had one bedroom (with two singles), and the livingroom had a sofa which substituted as a bed. Also had a table with chairs, and an easy chair to sit in. For a small fee (10 euros for all 3 days) we got a WiFi login/password, though it was far from the fastest connection I've had. Also has a color TV, with about 20 stations. Most are Spanish, but also included two German, one French, one Italian, CNN International (English), Eurosport (also English), and an MTV station that was sometimes English, sometimes German. There is a Starbucks at the end of the block (next to the Metro station) though it doesn't open until 10am. There is also a Pizza Hut literally two doors away, but i STRONGLY advise avoiding it! We got a pizza there one night (plain cheese) and we couldn't decide if the taste was perfume or industrial waste, but it was AWFUL! On the good side, there is a small supermarket on the ground floor of the hotel where you can get pop, snacks and fruit and cereral. By the way, if you're unfamiliar with Spain, most places close for lunch around noon-2 or 2:30, and close for the evening around 7-8pm. Its normal to go out for dinner at 8-10pm here (and unusual to eat any earlier than 7pm, in fact many restaurants don't even open until 8 or later). There is one person sitting in a little office in the entryway, and you check in with him, but other than that contact is minimal, and he offers no real help or information. There's also an outdoor swimming pool on the 2nd floor, but it wasn't open when we were there (too early in the season). FYI, the hotel is about 20-30 minutes from the airport (depending on time of day) by taxi and the fare runs about 30-35 euros. I would stay again, as hotels in Madrid can be very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: skw53
Reviews.Content: First the good parts: This hotel has a great location, close to many restaurants and a grocery store. The rooms have kitchenettes, dishes, cookware, table and chairs. Now the bad parts: The walls are paper-thin. I was hardly able to sleep because I had neighbors on one side who partied until late at night and neighbors on the other side who got up very early. Only some of the people who staff the front desk speak English. The rooms have no hair dryers.

Reviews.Title: “Not Really a Hotel, but a Fine Choice for the Savvy Traveler”
Reviews.Author: caltraveler954
Reviews.Content: This site is not really a hotel and does not have the kinds of services you would expect in a hotel although the front desk is manned 24 hours. Maid service with towel change is twice per week. Tell the front desk what time of day you prefer that service, so you are not surprised by the door buzzer. (There is no "Do Not Disturb" option, but once I understood the system, I simply asked that no one come before 11 AM, and all has been fine since.) I would absolutely stay here again. (I am a single woman here for a three month stint and have felt quite comfortable). The staff is very friendly and helpful. The neighborhood is one of the best in Madrid, the "old money" neighborhood of Salamanca, quite nice, very safe, and not overwhelmingly "touristy." As noted in the 2003 review, the metro is steps away, and one of the most efficient transportation systems I have used. Even the most die-hard suburbanites will be riding the metro to all points in Madrid within a day and with minimum effort. (If you have somehow ended up in Madrid with no Metro map, go down the steps into the station, walk up to the service window and ask for "un plano de metro.") A grocery store, restaurant, beauty shop, take out pizza shop, are on the immediate block, and several ATM machines within two blocks. Good thing--a great shopping district. If you need to park a car, you'll find a private garage. Studios and one-bedrooms have kitchenettes. I often walk to the city center, the Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia museums as well as to the beautiful Retiro Park. I'm a stroller, not a brisk walker (Madrid being a great city in which to stroll), so these walks take a good 30 minutes with window shopping stops along the way, but they are lovely! The metro cuts the transport time down to 10-15 minutes, depending on your destination. While I would probably think twice about staying here were this my first visit to Madrid and my time tight, if you are staying a week or longer, or are already somewhat familiar with the city, it's a very good choice. For those of you who are really bothered by noise, do note, the walls are thin; the traffic can get noisy at rush hour, and two hospitals are close, so you will hear sirens--I pop the earplugs in at night, though, and sleep like a baby! Visit their website at (-)apartamentos-jb.(-)/
